title: Art, Care and Coexistence - Elke Krasny in Conversation with Jenny Marketou
venue: MEGARON - The Athens Concert Hall (annex M)
short_description: Professor Elke Krasny and artist Jenny Marketou discuss art as a practice of care—an aesthetic, ethical, and political response to contemporary social and environmental challenges. Discussion in English with Q&A.

title: Jenny Marketou: Folly for Songs for Funk Kinships
short_description: Site-specific sculptural installation exploring relationships of care, materiality and coexistence between human and more-than-human organisms. Free admission until May 2026.

title: Andreas Ragnar Kassapis: Shame is an Object in Space
venue: MEGARON - The Athens Concert Hall (Ypiresiaki Avli)
short_description: Exhibition of paintings and textual elements exploring urban landscapes, interiors and objects. Through painting and poetry, the artist examines the distance between city and representation in the post-internet era. Runs until January 11, 2026. Opening November 5, 7pm. Ticket: €5, €3 (reduced).

title: Simone Leigh: Anatomy of Architecture
short_description: Exhibition by internationally acclaimed African-American sculptor Simone Leigh featuring three iconic bronze sculptures (Vessel, Bisi, Herm) exploring Black feminine identity. Last days until Wednesday November 5.

title: A Vessel for Me - The Art of Small Sculpture (Workshop)
short_description: Children's workshop experimenting with shape, balance and materiality, creating lightweight vessels from wire, fabric and humble materials transformed into personal micro-sculptural forms. 11:00-14:00.

title: Gumboot Dance & Click Songs Workshop
venue: Stavros Niarchos Foundation Cultural Center (SNFCC) - Agora
short_description: Through voice, movement and rhythm, participants learn the history and basic motifs of South African Gumboot dance and click song traditions. 12:00-14:30.

title: Listening Club: Female Identity Through African-American Music
venue: Stavros Niarchos Foundation Cultural Center (SNFCC) - Agora
short_description: Radio producer Giorgos Florakis moderates a listening club exploring female identity through African-American musical genres including gospel, blues, soul, jazz and hip hop. 17:00-19:00.

title: Camerata Orchestra: Mozart Concerti
short_description: Authentic sounds from Mozart's era brought to life by Camerata Orchestra musicians and distinguished Greek soloists under direction of Giorgos Petrou. Featuring period instruments including bassoon, traverso flute, 1802 harp and Walter piano replicas.

title: Camerata Orchestra: Schubert 8 - Beethoven 5
short_description: Giorgos Petrou conducts Camerata Orchestra on period instruments. Program features Schubert's 'Unfinished' Symphony with its lyrical melancholy, and Beethoven's Fifth Symphony, symbol of human spirit's struggle and triumph.

title: Camerata Orchestra: Monteverdi Vespro della Beata Vergine
short_description: One of sacred music's most stunning works, Monteverdi's Vespers of the Blessed Virgin, presented for the first time in Greece under direction of Emiliano Gonzalez Toro. Masterpiece combining Renaissance spirituality with early Baroque brilliance.

title: Camerata Orchestra: New Year with Vienna Spirit
short_description: Welcome 2026 with Camerata Orchestra and maestro Dionysis Grammenos. Evening filled with joy, elegance and rhythm featuring timeless Strauss family melodies—waltzes, polkas and marches—in the spirit of Vienna's famous New Year's Concert.

title: Nikolas Anadolis: Improvisations
short_description: Nikolas Anadolis presents a new cycle of works with romantic, cinematic and jazz aura—preludes, songs without words and intermezzi bridging classical with contemporary music. Program includes arrangements from Swan Lake and Cinema Paradiso.

title: Dimos Dimitriadis: Songs in Revolution
short_description: Dimos Dimitriadis and his quintet present excerpts from Dream Modes and Songs in Revolution: contemporary jazz with Mediterranean and cinematic hues, full of rhythm, improvisation and imagination.

title: Dimitris Kalantzis 4tet: Master's Voice - Tsitsanis
short_description: Dimitris Kalantzis quartet and Filarmonia Orchestra strings perform Vasilis Tsitsanis's immortal songs with jazz spirit. 100% jazz, 100% Tsitsanis.

title: Stacey Kent Trio
short_description: Award-winning singer Stacey Kent returns with her unique voice and multilingual repertoire. Jazz songs, chanson and bossa nova from albums A Time for Love and Songs From Other Places. With Art Hirahara and Jim Tomlinson.

title: Richard Bona - Alfredo Rodriguez Trio
short_description: Richard Bona and Alfredo Rodriguez, two international virtuosos united by legend Quincy Jones, meet in an explosive collaboration full of rhythm, passion and improvisation—from Cuba to Cameroon.
